blogContent: Does anyone have suggestions for apps to track my macro intakes.  Why do you recommend?

comments.reply: This is a great question Tom, Im wondering the same thing as I struggle to track my daily intakes with just pencil and paper
There is an app called MyFitnessPal that is free on the app store.  It has a decent UI and gives you everything you'll need to get started.

blogContent: When chest pressing I can only feel tension in my biceps and sholders.  Any tips to engage chest and triceps?

comments.reply: You should focus and bending the bar towards your toes.  And engage you lat muscles, while keeping your sholders back

blogContent: What type of cardio do people prefer.  Looking to lose weight fast and have a good sweat.

comments.reply: For me personally the best type of cardio is stairmaster.  Good sweat and works the calfs and quads
I love the stationary bike.  Its easy to adjust the tension and there are plenty of places to find spin classes if you prefer the motivation of a group setting.
I'd say walking on the treadmill can be best for calorie burning.  A slight incline and a constant speed for 10 to 15 minutes gives the same benefits as any other method

blogContent: I,ve been waking up extremely sore recently and think its time to start prioritizing recovery.  Any tips and tricks??

comments.reply: Invest in a massager of some kind, its a life saver
I would recommend a 10 minute stretch routine after every workout.
There are some supplements out there that can help with recovery but the most important thing is a healty diet. Make sure youre getting all the nutrients needed to recover
